reason: Potential circular reasoning via Archimedean assumption: The parent node 1.3.1 claims the weaker Archimedean condition (node 1.3) suffices, and this node 1.3.1.2 is one of the reasons why. But if Lemma 2.3 (which supposedly proves M is generating) ITSELF uses the Archimedean assumption from node 1.3, then we have circular reasoning: we're using the Archimedean assumption to prove M is generating, then using M being generating to justify the Archimedean assumption being sufficient. The proof of Lemma 2.3 must be inspected to verify it does NOT depend on any form of the Archimedean condition.
